item.title: Beogram 4002 (5503): A First Look
item.description:
I recently began restoring a Beogram 4002 (5503) AC-motor turntable purchased from eBay. I had sent the seller specific packaging instructions and a sturdy double-boxed container, which they thankfully followed, resulting in the unit arriving undamaged. Initial observations are as follows: The aluminum surfaces are generally in good shape, just needing a cleaning. The platter, in particular, has remarkably few imperfections. The keypad shows typical signs of use, with fingerprints visible on the most frequently pressed keys...

item.title: Beogram 4002 (5503): Repair of a Dead H-Bridge and Some Other Updates
item.description:
A Beogram 4002 turntable, previously restored in 2020, returned for repair. The issue was a familiar one: the carriage wouldn’t move towards the platter, suggesting a faulty power transistor in the carriage motor’s H-bridge. This recurring problem has become a pattern, leading to a routine replacement of the H-bridge transistors during restorations. However, this wasn’t standard practice in 2020, necessitating the turntable’s return for transistor replacement. Along with the H-bridge transistors, other known problematic components were also updated...
